title: 114_s2546
content: The Act is titled the "No Windfalls for Bailed Out Executives Act" and requires the repayment of certain nonqualified deferred compensation in cases of extraordinary governmental assistance. The Act, titled the "No Windfalls for Bailed Out Executives Act," mandates the repayment of deferred compensation if an employer receiving extraordinary governmental assistance fails to distribute or repay it within 36 months. The Act requires repayment of deferred compensation if not distributed or repaid within 36 months, with no further deferrals allowed until the extraordinary governmental assistance is fully repaid to the Federal Government. The Act requires repayment of deferred compensation within 36 months to prevent employer insolvency. Designated individuals include key employees, board members, and high-earning employees. The Act mandates repayment of deferred compensation within 36 months to avoid employer insolvency. Key individuals subject to this rule are key employees, board members, and high-earning employees. If compensation is not repaid or deferred in violation of the rules, additional taxes may apply. The tax imposed by this chapter may be increased by 100 percent of compensation not repaid or deferred in violation of rules, attributable to services performed during the taxable year. The tax imposed by this chapter may be increased by 100 percent of compensation not repaid or deferred in violation of rules, attributable to services performed during the taxable year. The effective tax rate on such compensation shall not exceed 100 percent. Coordination with employer withholding is required for applying section 3402(a) to compensation not repaid or deferred in violation of the rules. The tax rate on compensation subject to withholding is 100 percent instead of the usual rate under section 3402(a)(1). Amendments are made to sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective date applies to amounts deferred under nonqualified deferred compensation plans. The amendments made by this section apply to deferred compensation plans in taxable years after the enactment of this Act, specifically regarding earnings on deferred compensation.
